info.label: Test Automation Engineer at BJSS
info.brief: Software Development Engineer in Test interested in Health tech, Augmented Reality and Open Source software. Very interested in Lean and Agile & building and working in great teams that build products that deliver the most value to the user through continuously improving quality and processes.

employment.summary: 9 years development experience, 5 year experience working on open source, 8 years experience working in healthcare. 6 months working in Test Automation

history.summary: Working with NHS Somerset, the New Economics Foundation and AttDigital I was commissioned to design and develop an app for Android and iOS that helps user to keep track of their wellbeing and helps them set activities that will increase it. The app was built using Apache Cordova (formerly PhoneGap) to give the app an even playing field across both platforms as due to the project timeframe and also that I was still working my 9-5 job there was a very limited amount of time. The app runs on HTML, CSS3 and JavaScript using plugins to use the devices local storage, SQLite database and to fire the local notifications which remind the user to do the activities they set. While doing this project I increased my knowledge of PhoneGap / Cordova and updated a number of widely used plugins to use the newest version of Cordova.
highlights: Working with NHS Somerset and the New Economics Foundation to bring the 5 ways of wellbeing to Android and iOS devices
Used Apache Cordova to create Android and iOS apps using a single website source
Built additional functionality in Java and Objective-C to enhance database functionality on both Android and iOS platforms
Working with NHS Somerset's IT team to create a RESTful API to collect anonymised user activity data
Working with NHS Somerset to compile anonymised user activity data into charts to show NHS England the impact the app had

projects.title: Digitising mandatory publications
projects.description: As of 2011 St George's Healthcare NHS Trust publishes its Quality Account and Annual Reports online as separate microsites with a limited print run. This has saved the organisation around £5,000 in printing costs and has seen more people reading the documents than when they were printed. Both publications are mandatory documents and show the public the quality of care that St George's delivers and the Trust's finances for the past year. By using web technologies to publish the documents it's helped to make them more accessible, increased availability and as of 2012 made the information easy to view on mobile devices.
projects.summary: Moved St George's mandatory publications from print to websites and saved the organisation around £10,000 a year
highlights: Saved organisation £10,000 a year in printing costs
Made mandatory publications into websites

projects.title: Outpatient appointment amendment form
projects.description: I was asked by the outpatient department at St George's to add a way for patients to cancel or change the date of their appointment via the St George's website to help Did Not Attend (DNA) rates within the department. I accomplished this by creating an interactive and thoroughly validated form that patients can fill out on the website. Once the patient has submitted their details the outpatient appointment team is then notified and contacts the patient to help them to arrange a new date or confirm the cancellation. As part of the project I had to take on some server administration tasks like setting up SSL certificates and setting up redirects to that the form was only accessible via HTTPS so that all communications were encrypted.
projects.summary: Helped reduce Did Not Attend (DNA) rates for appointments at St George's Hospital's outpatient department by adding an appointment amendment form to the St George's Website.
highlights: Reduced Did Not Attend (DNA) rates for outpatient appointments

projects.title: Welcome to St George's Hospital iOS app
projects.description: Working with the patient information team, patient reference groups and patient information groups I initiated a project to build an app that augmented the current Welcome to St George's Hospital booklet given out to patients when they visit St George's Hospital. The app added a searchable contact list, interactive map (with overlay of the map that is provided in the leaflet) and provided feedback mechanisms for patients and the public to send complaints and compliments about staff to the central PPI team. The app has been downloaded 900 times as of June 2013 and a QR code has been added to all patient letters so that the app is available from the first interaction the patient has with the hospital.
projects.summary: Created an iOS app to enhance the existing leaflet given to patients attending appointments at St George's Hospital
highlights: Created an iOs app to enhance the existing leaflet given to patients
Used MapKit to create an interactive version of the map used to signpost around St George's
App was added to header of patient leaflets and downloaded 900 in a year
App was featured in local newspaper

projects.title: Clinical staff directory
projects.description: I worked with the Marketing team to create a database driven version of their outpatient service directory. The clinical staff directory offers clinical staff a profile where they can put their contact details as well as their interests and awards. The directory is searchable via name, directory, speciality and will in the future be used to power other parts of the website.
projects.summary: Created a searchable clinical staff directory to help advertise St George's expertise
highlights: Created a searchable clinical staff directory for St George's Hospital

projects.title: Queen Mary's Hospital subsite on the St George's website
projects.description: At short notice the team that I sit in were made aware of a CQUIN that involved creating a separate website for Queen Mary's Hospital in Roehampton as their existing website was to be taken down. CQUINs are one of the ways that NHS organisations get money so there was a lot at stake. Within a month my colleague Mike and I had to make sure that all the content on the existing website, liaise with service managers to make sure all the content was up to date and rework the navigation on the website (which is all hand coded by myself, so no CMS options here) to allow for content to be available under both normal navigation and the subsites navigation. This project also saw me attend meetings way above the scope that I would normally go to (my current position is fairly junior) as well as working very closely with senior members of the Queen Mary's team. The subsite was published on time and was well received by the Queen Mary's team and the GPs from who the CQUIN had come from.
projects.summary: Helped Queen Mary's Hospital meet a CQUIN target at short notice

projects.title: Adding St George's Hospital's interior to Google Maps
projects.description: Working with Google and the St George's Hospital drawing office I led the project to bring the interior of St George's Hospital to Google Maps, the first hospital in the UK to offer indoor maps. The indoor mapping project allows for patients, visitors, the public and staff to navigate their way through St George's 14 hectare site. The maps show the wards, clinics, corridors and points of interest like shops, lifts, toilets for the seven floors at the hospital. The project caught the interest of NHS Choices who then took the indoor mapping project across the NHS with around 60 Trusts taking part. I helped the NHS Choices team and wrote a couple of case study documents to help other Trusts take part.
projects.summary: Added St George's Hospital's interior to Google Maps becoming the first UK hospital to do so.
highlights: Co-ordinated both NHS and University sides of St George's Hospital to bring indoor mapping
Worked with NHS Choices to get other trusts in the UK to add their interiors to Google Maps
Maps were covered in local newspaper and in the evening standard

testimonials.name: Andy Bossom - University for the Creative Arts
testimonials.quote: I can heartily recommend Colin. He is a conscientious, heard working, lateral thinking creative individual who would bring a lot to any project.

testimonials.name: Alex Talbott - Yeovil Hospital NHS Foundation
testimonials.quote: I have worked with Colin on NHS Social Media, #nhssm (http://nhssm.org.uk), for the past 15 months. I can safely say that I am still yet to meet someone with a wider breadth and depth of IT and social media knowledge. Colin’s skills in programming across a host of different computer languages and ability to push the boundaries of what is already out there are only put in the shade by his ability to patiently and extremely clearly explain, in plain English, the impact IT and social media can have on all of us.     In my experience Colin is extremely capable in working with: php, HTML5, CSS, and the APIs of Twitter, Facebook, Google Maps and Foursquare and more.     Colin’s work on the #nhssm blog and chats are an example of what he is capable of in his spare time. His work on the St George’s NHS Trust annual report (see: http://www.stgeorges.nhs.uk/annual/default.asp) is groundbreaking and has raised the bar for all NHS Trusts across the UK.

testimonials.name: Srdan Srepfler - Addison Global - The Creators of MoPlay
testimonials.quote: Colin is a jack of all trades, development, testing, in any language. Always switched on, attentive to details and the bigger picture. If there's a higher cause, even better!

testimonials.name: Monica Barten - Standard Chartered Bank
testimonials.quote: If you need someone who understands social media and is at the forefront of the industry, Colin is someone you can rely on.  He understands how it fits into the marketing mix and has very good ideas in how communicators can be using social media better.

testimonials.name: Liz Woods - The Awareness Centre, Tooting
testimonials.quote: Colin effortlessly helps me and my team keep on top of developments in new media; we benefit hugely from his knowledge and expertise.

testimonials.name: Tim Lloyd - Helpful Digital and the Social Simulator
testimonials.quote: Colin is a great colleague. He's driven and bright, and can explain complex technical ideas in a way that is interesting.    I've always found Colin to be reliable and considerate, and a champion of digital engagement in health and the NHS.

testimonials.name: Suzanne Ruggles - FULL CIRCLE FUND THERAPIES
testimonials.quote: Colin established Full Circle Fund's online networking presence for fundraising events at St George's Healthcare Trust.  He's proactive, friendly, efficient and resourceful. Great to have his help and input.

testimonials.name: Ali Richards - Acute Frailty
testimonials.quote: Colin is the moderator for a fantastic and successful chat on twitter, #nhssm. He is a role model of someone who is reaching out to create wider engagement for social media in the healthcare  community. By facilitating an online chat once a week Colin is creating a new community and network of people who can share best practice and support each other in social media.
